Mn5w7yAqx0QdVxHGJFOxrw.text: I've only ever been to the old location at Rifle Range. The new set up is much bigger and yet they've somehow manage to keep the ambience cosy. Service is still as excellent as I remember. We had the squid ink pasta and the lobster midweek special. Perfection complete with the bruschetta and beef carpaccio. Definitely a must visit for anyone craving good authentic Italian. P.S. Tuesday's ladies night and you can a free glass of proseco with your main!

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. All time fave and special. Squid ink pasta
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. The midweek Wednesday special lobster spaghetti.

vQ6_uuQV0EyTl6q9q8GOdg.text: I found this Italian place is one of the best italian in singapore, however you have to meet Mr. Valentino himself and order with him. Its off the menu but its will be very very good, especially the red prawn w garlic pasta and tge tomahawk beef. Cant go wrong..

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Tomahawk beef
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Red prawn w garlic pasta
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Scampi grilled

v98HxyMAd0JQ2e9H2oJjGQ.text: Some hits and misses, but definitely outrageously expensive.Food-wise, the pasta is above average, but the price is definitely way far above average. I was wowed by the squid ink fettuccini, excited by the grilled octopus tentacle, bored by the beef ravioli and utterly disappointed by the bread sticks. (For the record, the breadsticks were crusty, hard and far too dry)Service is exceptionally attentive and professional, and possibly one of the best experiences I've had dining in Singapore. It's the kind of place you can bring someone on a first date. (And leave crying when you are handed the check)My wallet is now begging me for mercy. Kinda explains the Ferrari parked outside (which I'm told, belong to the owner of the restaurant).

mYzs2CSPeiR_CFraW1hx_g.text: Had a business dinner with an overseas client. Food and wine were good. Service was fine initially but the waiter was no where to be found towards the end of the meal. My client which travel to Europe frequently returned to Valentino few days later with his regional team.

Fl4AVJE667JTkSc-zLVA0A.text: I can't recall the last time a business was so arrogant and offensive, especially when serving fake wines. We were a group of nine.  They began by bringing us an appetizer we had not ordered.  When I mentioned that we did not order this item, the response was since no one else had ordered one they could not take it back and we had to take it.  Really?   We still ordered the item we wanted.But it gets better.......We were directed to the wine seller where we picked a 2005 Barolo for SGD $250.  The waiter dumped it into a decanter as if emptying out a jug of water.  No sediments in a 10 year old wine I thought to myself?   The color was faint, like a bad Pinot, or a cheap Beaujolais.   The taste was worse, bitter and oxidized.  As we had guests and judging by how they treated their mistake about the appetizer, I kept hush.    Weather they knowingly buy fake label wines or buy at deep discounts from a dishonest distributor, and look the other way, I can't be sure.    In fact, in a recent trip to Italy after my last visit to Valentino I had the same bottle, and long before taste, just by color you could tell Valentino's was fake.  A see through 11 year old Barolo...it will fool only those one who have leaned about wine by attending those weekend courses in Singapore. The food is good, but the offensive treatment and phony wines has me saying good bye after years of patronage which goes back to their prior location.

BWxrNWkY-FUaVPb46NeC6g.text: This is absolutely crap food.  This owner is making the worst food ever.  If this place was in an Italian area the doors would be shut. They start with dried out bread and some old cheap olive oil dipping sauce with anchovies flavor, really bad. We ordered the bruschetta and it was old diced tomatoes on a toasted old piece of bread that was tasteless.  Then we ordered the clams with linguini sauce absolute garbage, drenched in garlic to cover up the smell of the bad clams.  The main course was veal osso bucco.  This was overcooked and mussy with small canned potatoes.  The skillet fish was not fresh must be days old and then served.  My Italian friends and non Italians shut this place down.  The place is decorated like a toy store cafeteria.  Mr Valentino I want to cook you real Italian food, I extend an offer for you to experience real respected dining and fresh food, which you are taking advantage of the people in Singapore.  You should be ashamed of yourself.  Charge prices for the cafeteria food you are serving.  People beware this is not good, and travelers do not go, it's bad.

uISlEJi0xOQOhJt2G_Q_sQ.text: This is a review of a dinner date at Ristorante da Valentino.This was a very pleasant dining experience.  The entire experience (service, ambiance, menu) represent classic Italian dining.From the moment you are greeted, the staff is pleasant, professional, and informative.  Out of my entire experience at Valentino, the service is what stands out the most.Our "Captain" was obviously an experienced professional server.  He was consistently there.  He was very engaging.  He was very informative with the menu and what to expect.  I love the table side portioning of the appetizers.  It just adds a touch of sophistication and personalization to the experience.The ambiance is relatively classic fine dining.  It is large open space.  There are sporadic tchotchkes that add touches of charm along the way.The food ranged from flawed to excellent.  The starters were fantastic.  The squid pasta dish was amazing.  For some reason, each of our mains were disappointing.  My dinner date was very dissatisfied with her main.Ciabatta Bread - This was very good.  It was warm with a mild flavour and there was a very nice dipping oil for it.  (I am going to note here.  This was presented as complimentary bread but it is not.  They charge $6.50 for it.  I expect this in lesser restaurants in Singapore.  I do not expect it in a dining experience that is going to run over the $500 mark.  They simply do not need to stoop to this level.)  tinyurl.com/m6kuebpBurrata with tomatoes - This was simply a plate of heaven.  The creamy warm burrata.  The tomatoes had a light sweetness.  The small bit of ham for additional saltiness.  Even the greens worked to add some additional texture and a peppery bite. The dish was brought to the table as a complete dish.  Our "captain" then cut and portioned the dish.tinyurl.com/lw6gmyuGrilled Octopus Tentacle - This was so very good. The octopus was tender.  There was a soft smokiness from the searing.  It was just delicious.This dish was also brought to the table whole and then portioned table-side.tinyurl.com/md55gcnSquid Ink Fettuccini with crab meat - This was our selection for a pasta course.  This was rich and creamy goodness.  I think I finished my portion in two minutes.  I have never wielded a pasta spoon with such speed and grace.  The crab was buttery.  The pasta was perfectly prepared. The sauce was silky.  The squid ink was perfectly restrained.tinyurl.com/lf3v7jwManzo Gorgonzola (steak with bleu cheese) - This was my main course.  This was a basic and neatly presented dish.  Unfortunately, I did not like it very much.  It came down to the beef.  I simply did not enjoy the flavour of the meat.  It was cooked to a perfect medium rare.  I just didn't enjoy the way it tasted.  I also thought the bleu cheese would play a stronger role in the flavour  profile.  The sides were basic and lacked imagination.tinyurl.com/m9ypje6Sirloin with foie gras - My dinner companion selected this item from the evening's specials.  She did not enjoy it. Primarily, she stated the rosemary was dominating the entire flavour of the dish.  This is an easy mistake to make when using fresh rosemary.  She did not eat very much of her main course.I do not have a photo of this dish.Lemon Sorbet - This was her dessert.  It was elegantly presented using the frozen rind of a lemon.  She seemed to enjoy it.  I did not try it.  tinyurl.com/mofovkoSalame Cioccolat - This was a chocolate cookie dish with ice cream.  I found it to be an average chocolate dish.   It's chocolate.  So, it was good.  But, it was not anything special.  I also found the hardness of the cookies made it a little challenging to eat.tinyurl.com/mrwj9snReceipt (Dinner for two): $530.00tinyurl.com/lh3256aOverall - I do think this was a very enjoyable experience.  I can't say enough great things about the service.  The ambiance is classic fine dining.  The menu is diverse.  It all fits so well together.  The food had some extreme high points (starters through  pasta course).  However, the main courses fell a little short and this is the reason I am only providing a four star review.  I would not hesitate to return. I also think it an excellent option for a special dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Manzo Gorgonzola (steak with bleu cheese) - Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Squid Ink Fettuccini with crab meat - Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Receipt - Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore

tJO3-svd0DchGMSek9oDUQ.text: My first visit was when they were a small cozy outfit at Rifle Range. Came back last weekend for dinner at their new home at Turf City. Food was still excellent. Still impressed by their aged beef served on a wooden board (didn't get the dish name). Lightly seasoned, moist and so tender. Mouth watering delicious. Go for the lightly charred parts and I reckon you will remember the taste for a long time. Desserts: they don't do trolley service anymore what a shame. Don't let that stop you from going up to the display to see what's available. The panna cotta is an absolute must try. Flawless service. Attentive and personable. What can I say- I love this place!

NjijhMpRbOtKHIWmJ2RTHQ.text: There aren't many Italian restaurants in Singapore that serve such wonderfulHomely food. The service is often top notch. A tip would be to order the specials such as the buffalo mozza or the grilled octupus leg. This is quite a pricey restaurant though.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Squid ink crab meat pasta

hH6GFecnuP0Bk6WK_z5fJg.text: The more other Italian places I go to in Singapore, the more overpriced I think this is. I prefer Trattoria Lafiandra, Bella Pasta, and Cicheti.

cZETHuLIMUU0EqObMrF3VQ.text: I was a fan of the old location - intimate, like being in a family trattoria in Italy, great food and service.  This cavernous new location...  hmm, not so sure.  It seems deliberately kitsch, and the staff - well the staff need improving.  For a start, with a pregnant wife this was just a quick pit-stop dinner on the way home from work.  A 6pm seating was booked - yet at 6.05pm we were still standing outside waiting for a staff meeting to finish.  Small details, they matter.  Then we found ourselves seated - in this huge place! - right next to the only two other 6pm customers.  Where's the logic in that?  They were loud banking types determined to out-impress each other so we needed to relocate - to a table where, at one point, THREE wait staff all were hovering above us like vultures.  It was the antithesis of discrete service.Finally things calmed down, food was ordered and we looked to relax.  But we'd not even finished our bruschetta before an attempt was made to put pasta on the (small) table.  We asked that the main be served once the starter was finished (reasonable, IMO).  The staff happily complied, but judging by the wait time the whole dishes needed to be re-made (and kudos to the restaurant for doing this).  Food was fine, standard Italian.  Though the 'porcini' pasta was more like a garlic pasta with porcini highlights.At $100 for two pastas, a bottle of sparkling water and a bruschetta it was over-priced - which would be fine if the experience, ambience and service all were great, but it was kinda average all 'round.  A shame, as I used to like this place.  Ciao.

oEuOrJhcEEB9AI7ijANFTA.text: I wasn't quite as blown away as everyone else at Valentino, so feel free to take my review with a pinch of salt. I went there to celebrate a friend's birthday. We got the private room, everything was pre-ordered, and there was plenty of food to go around.First off, the service was excellent. We had a person assigned to our room, he was friendly, helpful, and was always able to get us whatever we needed (plates, condiments, etc.). He was also very friendly, and in fact the entire team was. It was a very warm, personable dining experience, and I cannot fault the service at all. Food wise, the antipasti was good... borderline great. We had some grilled vegetables, marinated mushrooms, ham, the usual basically and it was all of good quality. I just wasn't blown away because that's really the minimum you expect now of a respectable Italian restaurant. I actually found the pastas very mediocre. We had a vegetarian Aglio Olio and a ricotta and spinach cannellon. Neither were spectacular, both were just good. The mains of fish and pork were also unspectacular. Good but so uneventful that I just remember being satisfied, but unimpressed. Maybe they just didn't suit my palate, maybe we just ordered the wrong things.I'd would come back even if I only rated it 3 stars because maybe I just didn't order the right items. At least, that MUST be the case if everyone else rates them so highly.

x0oUiWMkwnz0qfJ8Pqhz3Q.text: Still my favourite Italian restaurant in this country. Yes, I like it more than the higher end Italian restaurants.It's moved to a new location on Turf Club Road (sadness). Its original Jalan Bingka/Rifle Range location was perfect, because it was so hidden away. It still maintains the sense of hiddenaway-ness, even with larger space at Turf Club Road.Diners who have been going to Valentino for a long time will fondly remember the living room and how it was such an integral part of the entire Valentino experience. This restaurant was never atas or fancy -- it was warm, homely, and made you happy with the great food from the great family that made it. Chef Valentino cooks with his mother Alma. It's beautiful.The food is still good, still very authentic, and sometimes it seems like various family members will just spring up and go to cook you something... and that's good! "Try my mama's lemon tart!" When someone enthusiastically wants you to try his mother's desserts, you must.I have been eating here for a long time and.. I love everything. Especially the squid ink pasta. I love all the risottos, and all the mains, and all the appetizers... I love everything here. Most of all I love the warmth of this family and the amazing place they've built together. Truly a gem of the west.

fWOH17GHGbJlkOv5H6KC_w.text: Valentinos is small family run Italian restaurant here in Singapore. Having visited Italy, I would say this place is the most authentic you can get here on the island. Amazing food and even more amazing Italian hospitality. The staff (all family) go out of their way to talk to you and make you feel welcome. You feel as though you are entering their home for a meal.Food is fantastic and very authentic. A must try is the burata mozzaralla served with tomatoes. Its flown in straight from Italy and is amazing. Try their desserts as well, all made by the daughter, Perla.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore

8zPeXI4COpqV1nLGk4NqgA.text: Ristorante da Valentino is a truly italian restaurant. Maybe the only really italian restaurant in Singapore, very authentic. It is run by a family, who is very warm and after all these years they work just as hard for you to make you happy. When you celebrate a birthday here the whole family comes out and sing for you. And this is while they don't have to do that because they already made their money, visible from the ferrari's outside. The food is amazing, fresh and intense. Italian cuisine at it's best. Simple dishes with high quality ingredients prepared perfectly. My favorite is the mozzarella and the truffel pasta's. Their desserts are made by Perla, who also has a store at the Taka basement.

Fi91-TcH2ZICd652fHMAUg.text: This place serves the most delicious italian food I can find in Singapore. Very authentic, very home-style. The decor is beautiful, very old-school Italian with a touch of modern art. They have a nice patio and herb garden that they are still working on, but the interior of the place is already sufficient to leave an impression, with an eclectic display of various vintage appliances, photographs of various parts of Italy, and salmon colored tablecloths (which I never thought could work...anywhere.). If you plan on coming here, please plan on paying around 100 per pax. The mains are around 20-50 dollars, but you have to pay for bread ($5.50) and my mixed berries cheesecake was 16 bucks. A glass of pinot grigio was 20 bucks, go figure. I guess I'm used to homestyle italian restaurants back in southern california where they offer free bread and offer a free dessert on your birthday....Anywho, the food was delectable. We had the burrata with cherry tomatoes and greens, and the burrata was very milky and fresh and was a delight to eat. The tomatoes were from Sicily and very ripe and sweet. We had the fried anchovies too, which is a Roman specialty, and it was comparable to that served in Roma. My squid ink fettucine with crabmeat in a creamy tomato sauce was a tad too creamy for me, although the flavor was very good and the crabmeat was very sweet. I really enjoyed the gnocchi in gorganzola sauce. The gnocchi was like soft pillows of pleasure and definitely home made. I would come back just for the gnocchi. My mixed berry cheesecake was very light, fluffy and just the right amount of sweetness. One of the better desserts I've had in a while. In general, a good place to splurge at for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Gnocchi in gorganzola sauce
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Squid ink fettuccine with crabmeat in creamy tomato sauce
Photo of Ristorante da Valentino - Singapore, Singapore. Fried anchovies

VoeRn90EkvKNKN0DBhKVOw.text: The food that we had today was all very ordinary. Tasteless and served with little or no energy. They made us feel that we should be happy they allowed us to eat there. Except for the appetiser the 2 pastas and the pizza were pedestrian at best.

w3DMwz3iUcaEjlLPdgWHxw.text: Very poor. My friend is a regular here so we came here to celebrate a friend's 26th birthday. The food was all well and fine, but here's the kicker:I had brought an expensive custom-decorated cake for my friend's birthday. There was a mix-up and the waitstaff served it to another party that was celebrating a birthday. In the first place, I do not know how such a mix-up could occur, since my friend's name was clearly spelt out on the cake. The chef apologized, the manager apologized, we were given a complimentary bottle of Prosecco and our cake was replaced with a cake of their own, which we personally thought was mediocre in comparison to the cake I had brought. They also placed 38 candles on the cake, without even asking us how old she was. We barely touched the cake. Only after we made it known to them the trouble and cost of our cake did they decide to give us a discount on our bill. Fine, these things happen I suppose. This is where it gets worse. I had decided to ask the staff if there was any portion left of the cake I had brought, since I thought it only right that the birthday girl at least get a taste of the cake I had taken the trouble to order for her. They told us that no, nothing was left. Later on, we saw the party they had served our cake to leave with a cake box. The cake box was also in a different plastic bag than the one I had brought it in (I had gotten it straight from a hotel, and had carried it in a bag from that hotel). Clearly there was a portion of the cake left. It also appeared to me that Valentino had deliberately covered up their mistake to the other patrons and taken credit for a cake that was not their own. A cake that the other party claimed was 'very good', I was told by their manager. Their mistake was forgivable, but the insincerity and dishonesty not so much. Terribly disappointing, since our otherwise pleasant evening had been marred by this incident. My friends and I will not be returning to this establishment.
